access_token.description: Bearer token granting privileges to Okta API.

api_token.description: API Token granting privileges to Okta API.

backoff.description: Use exponential back off strategy for rate limits.

base_url.description: The Okta url. (Use 'oktapreview.com' for Okta testing)

client_id.description: API Token granting privileges to Okta API.

http_proxy.description: Alternate HTTP proxy of scheme://hostname or scheme://hostname:port format

log_level.description: providers log level. Minimum is 1 (TRACE), and maximum is 5 (ERROR)

max_api_capacity.description: (Experimental) sets what percentage of capacity the provider can use of the total rate limit capacity while making calls to the Okta management API endpoints. Okta API operates in one minute buckets. See Okta Management API Rate Limits: https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/rl-global-mgmt/

max_retries.description: maximum number of retries to attempt before erroring out.

max_wait_seconds.description: maximum seconds to wait when rate limit is hit. We use exponential backoffs when backoff is enabled.

min_wait_seconds.description: minimum seconds to wait when rate limit is hit. We use exponential backoffs when backoff is enabled.

org_name.description: The organization to manage in Okta.

parallelism.description: Number of concurrent requests to make within a resource where bulk operations are not possible. Take note of https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/getting_started/rate-limits.

private_key.description: API Token granting privileges to Okta API.

private_key_id.description: API Token Id granting privileges to Okta API.

request_timeout.description: Timeout for single request (in seconds) which is made to Okta, the default is `0` (means no limit is set). The maximum value can be `300`.

scopes.description: API Token granting privileges to Okta API.

description.description: A human-readable description of the new Role

label.description: The name given to the new Role

permissions.description: The permissions that the new Role grants.

block.description: Resource to manage administrative Role assignments for a User

members.description: The hrefs that point to User(s) and/or Group(s) that receive the Role

resource_set_id.description: ID of the target Resource Set

block.description: Resource to manage the assignment and unassignment of Custom Roles

apps.description: List of app names (name represents set of app instances) or a combination of app name and app instance ID (like 'salesforce' or 'facebook.0oapsqQ6dv19pqyEo0g3')

role_type.description: Type of the role that is assigned to the user and supports optional targets

app_id.description: The application ID; this value is immutable and can not be updated.

id.description: The ID of the resource. This ID is simply the application ID.

block.description: Manages assignment of Access Policy to an Application

app_links_json.description: Displays specific appLinks for the app

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

logo.description: Local path to logo of the application.

shared_password.description: Shared password, required for certain schemes.

shared_username.description: Shared username, required for certain schemes.

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

authentication_policy.description: Id of this apps authentication policy

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

logo.description: Local path to logo of the application.

request_integration.description: Would you like Okta to add an integration for this app?

retain_assignment.description: Retain the group assignment on destroy. If set to true, the resource will be removed from state but not from the Okta app.

app_id.description: The ID of the application to assign a group to.

id.description: A group to associate with the application

block.description: A group to assign to this application

app_links_json.description: Displays specific appLinks for the app

authentication_policy.description: Id of this apps authentication policy

client_basic_secret.description: OAuth client secret key, this can be set when token_endpoint_auth_method is client_secret_basic.

client_id.description: OAuth client ID. If set during creation, app is created with this id.

client_secret.description: OAuth client secret key. This will be in plain text in your statefile unless you set omit_secret above.

client_uri.description: URI to a web page providing information about the client.

consent_method.description: *Early Access Property*. Indicates whether user consent is required or implicit. Valid values: REQUIRED, TRUSTED. Default value is TRUSTED

grant_types.description: List of OAuth 2.0 grant types. Conditional validation params found here https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/resources/apps#credentials-settings-details. Defaults to minimum requirements per app type.

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

implicit_assignment.description: *Early Access Property*. Enable Federation Broker Mode.

issuer_mode.description: *Early Access Property*. Indicates whether the Okta Authorization Server uses the original Okta org domain URL or a custom domain URL as the issuer of ID token for this client.

login_mode.description: The type of Idp-Initiated login that the client supports, if any

login_scopes.description: List of scopes to use for the request

logo.description: Local path to logo of the application.

logo_uri.description: URI that references a logo for the client.

omit_secret.description: This tells the provider not to persist the application's secret to state. If this is ever changes from true => false your app will be recreated.

pkce_required.description: Require Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE) for additional verification key rotation mode. See: https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/apps/#oauth-credential-object

policy_uri.description: URI to web page providing client policy document.

post_logout_redirect_uris.description: List of URIs for redirection after logout. Note: see okta_app_oauth_post_logout_redirect_uri for appending to this list in a decentralized way.

profile.description: Custom JSON that represents an OAuth application's profile

redirect_uris.description: List of URIs for use in the redirect-based flow. This is required for all application types except service. Note: see okta_app_oauth_redirect_uri for appending to this list in a decentralized way.

refresh_token_leeway.description: *Early Access Property* Grace period for token rotation, required with grant types refresh_token

refresh_token_rotation.description: *Early Access Property* Refresh token rotation behavior, required with grant types refresh_token

response_types.description: List of OAuth 2.0 response type strings.

token_endpoint_auth_method.description: Requested authentication method for the token endpoint.

tos_uri.description: URI to web page providing client tos (terms of service).

wildcard_redirect.description: *Early Access Property*. Indicates if the client is allowed to use wildcard matching of redirect_uris

filter_type.description: Groups claim filter. Can only be set if type is FILTER.

issuer_mode.description: Issuer mode inherited from OAuth App

name.description: Name of the claim that will be used in the token.

value.description: Value of the claim. Can be an Okta Expression Language statement that evaluates at the time the token is minted.

block.description: Groups claim for an OpenID Connect client application (argument is ignored when API auth is done with OAuth 2.0 credentials)

x.description: X coordinate of the elliptic curve point

y.description: Y coordinate of the elliptic curve point

issuer.description: The issuer of your Org Authorization Server, your Org URL.

scopes.description: Scopes of the application for which consent is granted.

uri.description: Post Logout Redirect URI to append to Okta OIDC application.
Redirect URI to append to Okta OIDC application.

client_id.description: Client ID for the role to be assigned to

resource_set.description: Resource set for the custom role to assign, must be the ID of the created resource set.

type.description: Role type to assign. This can be one of the standard Okta roles, such as `HELP_DESK_ADMIN`, or `CUSTOM`. Using custom requires the `resource_set` and `role` attributes to be set.

block.description: Manages assignment of an admin role to an OAuth application

acs_endpoints.description: List of ACS endpoints for this SAML application

app_links_json.description: Displays specific appLinks for the app

assertion_signed.description: Determines whether the SAML assertion is digitally signed

authentication_policy.description: Id of this apps authentication policy

authn_context_class_ref.description: Identifies the SAML authentication context class for the assertionâ€™s authentication statement

certificate.description: cert from SAML XML metadata payload

default_relay_state.description: Identifies a specific application resource in an IDP initiated SSO scenario.

destination.description: Identifies the location where the SAML response is intended to be sent inside of the SAML assertion

digest_algorithm.description: Determines the digest algorithm used to digitally sign the SAML assertion and response

embed_url.description: The url that can be used to embed this application in other portals.

entity_key.description: Entity ID, the ID portion of the entity_url

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

honor_force_authn.description: Prompt user to re-authenticate if SP asks for it

implicit_assignment.description: *Early Access Property*. Enable Federation Broker Mode.

key_name.description: Certificate name. This modulates the rotation of keys. New name == new key.

key_years_valid.description: Number of years the certificate is valid.

logo.description: Local path to logo of the application.

preconfigured_app.description: Name of preexisting SAML application. For instance 'slack'

recipient.description: The location where the app may present the SAML assertion

request_compressed.description: Denotes whether the request is compressed or not.

response_signed.description: Determines whether the SAML auth response message is digitally signed

saml_version.description: SAML version for the app's sign-on mode

signature_algorithm.description: Signature algorithm used ot digitally sign the assertion and response

single_logout_certificate.description: x509 encoded certificate that the Service Provider uses to sign Single Logout requests

single_logout_issuer.description: The issuer of the Service Provider that generates the Single Logout request

single_logout_url.description: The location where the logout response is sent

subject_name_id_template.description: Template for app user's username when a user is assigned to the app

name.description: The reference name of the attribute statement

namespace.description: The name format of the attribute

type.description: The type of attribute statements object

app_links_json.description: Displays specific appLinks for the app

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

logo.description: Local path to logo of the application.

optional_field1.description: Name of optional param in the login form

optional_field1_value.description: Name of optional value in login form

optional_field2.description: Name of optional param in the login form

optional_field2_value.description: Name of optional value in login form

optional_field3.description: Name of optional param in the login form

optional_field3_value.description: Name of optional value in login form

shared_password.description: Shared password, required for certain schemes.

shared_username.description: Shared username, required for certain schemes.

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

logo.description: Local path to logo of the application.

redirect_url.description: Secondary URL of the sign-in page for this app

shared_password.description: Shared password, required for certain schemes.

shared_username.description: Shared username, required for certain schemes.

url_regex.description: A regex that further restricts URL to the specified regex

access.description: Allow or deny access based on the rule conditions: ALLOW or DENY

constraints.description: An array that contains nested Authenticator Constraint objects that are organized by the Authenticator class

custom_expression.description: This is an optional advanced setting. If the expression is formatted incorrectly or conflicts with conditions set above, the rule may not match any users.

device_assurances_included.description: List of device assurance IDs to include

device_is_managed.description: If the device is managed. A device is managed if it's managed by a device management system. When managed is passed, registered must also be included and must be set to true.

device_is_registered.description: If the device is registered. A device is registered if the User enrolls with Okta Verify that is installed on the device.

factor_mode.description: The number of factors required to satisfy this assurance level

groups_excluded.description: List of group IDs to exclude

groups_included.description: List of group IDs to include

inactivity_period.description: The inactivity duration after which the end user must re-authenticate. Use the ISO 8601 Period format for recurring time intervals.

network_connection.description: Network selection mode: ANYWHERE, ZONE, ON_NETWORK, or OFF_NETWORK.

re_authentication_frequency.description: The duration after which the end user must re-authenticate, regardless of user activity. Use the ISO 8601 Period format for recurring time intervals. PT0S - Every sign-in attempt, PT43800H - Once per session

risk_score.description: The risk score specifies a particular level of risk to match on: ANY, LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH

system.description: Often the "Catch-all Rule" this rule is the system (default) rule for its associated policy

user_types_excluded.description: Set of User Type IDs to exclude

user_types_included.description: Set of User Type IDs to include

users_excluded.description: Set of User IDs to exclude

users_included.description: Set of User IDs to include

os_expression.description: Only available with OTHER OS type

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

shared_username.description: Shared username, required for certain schemes.

url_regex.description: A regex that further restricts URL to the specified regex

profile.description: The JSON profile of the App User.

retain_assignment.description: Retain the user assignment on destroy. If set to true, the resource will be removed from state but not from the Okta app.

username.description: The username to use for the app user. In case the user is assigned to the app with `SHARED_USERNAME_AND_PASSWORD` credentials scheme, this field will be computed and should not be set.

app_id.description: The Application's ID the user schema property should be assigned to.

master.description: SubSchema profile manager, if not set it will inherit its setting.

pattern.description: The validation pattern to use for the subschema. Must be in form of '.+', or '[<pattern>]+' if present.'

permissions.description: SubSchema permissions: HIDE, READ_ONLY, or READ_WRITE.

type.description: Subschema type: string, boolean, number, integer, array, or object

app_id.description: The Application's ID the user custom schema property should be assigned to.

array_enum.description: Custom Subschema enumerated value of a property of type array.

array_type.description: Subschema array type: string, number, integer, reference. Type field must be an array.

enum.description: Custom Subschema enumerated value of the property. see: developer.okta.com/docs/api/resources/schemas#user-profile-schema-property-object

master.description: SubSchema profile manager, if not set it will inherit its setting.

max_length.description: Subschema of type string maximum length

min_length.description: Subschema of type string minimum length

permissions.description: SubSchema permissions: HIDE, READ_ONLY, or READ_WRITE.

scope.description: determines whether an app user attribute can be set at the Personal `SELF` or Group `NONE` level. Default value is `NONE`.

type.description: Subschema type: string, boolean, number, integer, array, or object

union.description: Allows to assign attribute's group priority

block.description: array of valid JSON schemas for property type array.
Custom Subschema json schemas. see: developer.okta.com/docs/api/resources/schemas#user-profile-schema-property-object

audiences.description: Currently Okta only supports a single value here

credentials_last_rotated.description: The timestamp when the authorization server started to use the `kid` for signing tokens.

credentials_next_rotation.description: The timestamp when the authorization server changes the key for signing tokens. Only returned when `credentials_rotation_mode` is `AUTO`.

credentials_rotation_mode.description: Credential rotation mode, in many cases you cannot set this to MANUAL, the API will ignore the value and you will get a perpetual diff. This should rarely be used.

description.description: The description of the authorization server.

issuer.description: allows you to use a custom issuer URL

issuer_mode.description: *Early Access Property*. Indicates which value is specified in the issuer of the tokens that a Custom Authorization Server returns: the original Okta org domain URL or a custom domain URL

kid.description: The ID of the JSON Web Key used for signing tokens issued by the authorization server.

name.description: The name of the authorization server.

always_include_in_token.description: Specifies whether to include claims in token, by default it is set to `true`.

claim_type.description: Specifies whether the claim is for an access token `RESOURCE` or ID token `IDENTITY`.

group_filter_type.description: Specifies the type of group filter if `value_type` is `GROUPS`. Can be set to one of the following `STARTS_WITH`, `EQUALS`, `CONTAINS`, `REGEX`.

scopes.description: Auth server claim list of scopes

value_type.description: The type of value of the claim. It can be set to `EXPRESSION` or `GROUPS`. It defaults to `EXPRESSION`.

always_include_in_token.description: Specifies whether to include claims in token.

claim_type.description: Specifies whether the claim is for an access token `RESOURCE` or ID token `IDENTITY`.

scopes.description: Auth server claim list of scopes

value_type.description: The type of value of the claim.

audiences.description: Currently Okta only supports a single value here

credentials_last_rotated.description: The timestamp when the authorization server started to use the `kid` for signing tokens.

credentials_next_rotation.description: The timestamp when the authorization server changes the key for signing tokens. Only returned when `credentials_rotation_mode` is `AUTO`.

credentials_rotation_mode.description: Credential rotation mode, in many cases you cannot set this to MANUAL, the API will ignore the value and you will get a perpetual diff. This should rarely be used.

description.description: The description of the authorization server.

issuer.description: allows you to use a custom issuer URL

issuer_mode.description: *Early Access Property*. Indicates which value is specified in the issuer of the tokens that a Custom Authorization Server returns: the original Okta org domain URL or a custom domain URL

kid.description: The ID of the JSON Web Key used for signing tokens issued by the authorization server.

name.description: The name of the authorization server. Not necessary but left for backwards capacity with legacy implementation.

auth_server_id.description: The ID of the Auth Server.

client_whitelist.description: The clients to whitelist the policy for. `[ALL_CLIENTS]` is a special value that can be used to whitelist all clients, otherwise it is a list of client ids.

description.description: The description of the Auth Server Policy.

name.description: The name of the Auth Server Policy.

priority.description: Priority of the auth server policy

access_token_lifetime_minutes.description: Lifetime of access token. Can be set to a value between 5 and 1440 minutes. Default is `60`.

grant_type_whitelist.description: Accepted grant type values: authorization_code, implicit, password, client_credentials

group_blacklist.description: Specifies a set of Groups whose Users are to be excluded.

group_whitelist.description: Specifies a set of Groups whose Users are to be included. Can be set to Group ID or to the following: `EVERYONE`.

inline_hook_id.description: The ID of the inline token to trigger.

priority.description: Priority of the auth server policy rule

refresh_token_window_minutes.description: Window in which a refresh token can be used. It can be a value between 5 and 2628000 (5 years) minutes. Default is `10080` (7 days).`refresh_token_window_minutes` must be between `access_token_lifetime_minutes` and `refresh_token_lifetime_minutes`.

scope_whitelist.description: Scopes allowed for this policy rule. They can be whitelisted by name or all can be whitelisted with ` * `

system.description: The rule is the system (default) rule for its associated policy

type.description: Auth server policy rule type, unlikely this will be anything other then the default

user_blacklist.description: Specifies a set of Users to be excluded.

user_whitelist.description: Specifies a set of Users to be included.

consent.description: EA Feature and thus it is simply ignored if the feature is off

default.description: A default scope will be returned in an access token when the client omits the scope parameter in a token request, provided this scope is allowed as part of the access policy rule.

description.description: Description of the Auth Server Scope.

display_name.description: Name of the end user displayed in a consent dialog box

metadata_publish.description: Whether to publish metadata or not, matching API type despite the fact it could just be a boolean

key.description: A human-readable string that identifies the Authenticator

provider_auth_port.description: The RADIUS server port (for example 1812). This is defined when the On-Prem RADIUS server is configured

provider_hostname.description: Server host name or IP address

provider_shared_secret.description: An authentication key that must be defined when the RADIUS server is configured, and must be the same on both the RADIUS client and server.

provider_type.description: Provider type. Supported value for Duo: `DUO`. Supported value for Custom App: `PUSH`

location_granularity_type.description: Determines the method and level of detail used to evaluate the behavior.

number_of_authentications.description: The number of recent authentications used to evaluate the behavior.

agree_to_custom_privacy_policy.description: Consent for updating the custom privacy policy URL.

brand_id.description: Brand ID - Note: Okta API for brands only reads and updates therefore the okta_brand resource needs to act as a quasi data source. Do this by setting brand_id.

email_domain_id.description: Email Domain ID tied to this brand

links.description: Link relations for this object - JSON HAL - Discoverable resources related to the brand

locale.description: The language specified as an IETF BCP 47 language tag

remove_powered_by_okta.description: Removes "Powered by Okta" from the Okta-hosted sign-in page and "Â© 2021 Okta, Inc." from the Okta End-User Dashboard

block.description: Manages brand

secret_key.description: Secret key issued from the CAPTCHA vendor to perform server-side validation for a CAPTCHA token

site_key.description: Site key issued from the CAPTCHA vendor to render a CAPTCHA on a page

enabled_for.description: Set of pages that have CAPTCHA enabled

certificate_source_type.description: Optional. Certificate source type that indicates whether the certificate is provided by the user or Okta. Accepted values: MANUAL, OKTA_MANAGED. Warning: Use of OKTA_MANAGED requires a feature flag to be enabled. Default value = MANUAL

dns_records.description: TXT and CNAME records to be registered for the Domain

force_is_default.description: Force is_default on the create and delete by deleting all email customizations. Comma separated string with values of 'create' or 'destroy' or both `create,destroy'.

is_default.description: Whether the customization is the default

language.description: The language supported by the customization

links.description: Link relations for this object - JSON HAL - Discoverable resources related to the email template

dns_validation_records.description: TXT and cname records to be registered for the email Domain

validation_status.description: Status of the email domain. Values: NOT_STARTED, IN_PROGRESS, VERIFIED, COMPLETED

dns_records.description: TXT and CNAME records to be registered for the Domain

auth.description: Authentication required for event hook request.

channel.description: Details of the endpoint the event hook will hit.

events.description: The events that will be delivered to this hook. [See here for a list of supported events](https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/event-types/?q=event-hook-eligible).

block.description: Map of headers to send along in event hook request.

otp_length.description: Length of the password. Default is `6`.

custom_profile_attributes.description: JSON formatted custom attributes for a group. It must be JSON due to various types Okta allows.

skip_users.description: Ignore users sync. This is a temporary solution until 'users' field is supported in all the app-like resources

track_all_users.description: The resource concerns itself with all users added/deleted to the group; even those managed outside of the resource.

users.description: The list of Okta user IDs which the group should have membership managed for.

block.description: Resource to manage a set of group memberships for a specific group.

disable_notifications.description: When this setting is enabled, the admins won't receive any of the default Okta administrator emails

group_id.description: ID of group to attach admin roles to

target_app_list.description: List of apps ids for the targets of the admin role.

target_group_list.description: List of groups ids for the targets of the admin role.

remove_assigned_users.description: Remove users added by this rule from the assigned group after deleting this resource

users_excluded.description: The list of user IDs that would be excluded when rules are processed

array_enum.description: Custom Subschema enumerated value of a property of type array.

array_type.description: Subschema array type: string, number, integer, reference. Type field must be an array.

enum.description: Custom Subschema enumerated value of the property. see: developer.okta.com/docs/api/resources/schemas#user-profile-schema-property-object

master.description: SubSchema profile manager, if not set it will inherit its setting.

max_length.description: Subschema of type string maximum length

min_length.description: Subschema of type string minimum length

permissions.description: SubSchema permissions: HIDE, READ_ONLY, or READ_WRITE.

block.description: array of valid JSON schemas for property type array.
Custom Subschema json schemas. see: developer.okta.com/docs/api/resources/schemas#user-profile-schema-property-object

issuer_mode.description: Indicates whether Okta uses the original Okta org domain URL, custom domain URL, or dynamic. See Identity Provider attributes - issuerMode - https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/idps/#identity-provider-attributes

request_signature_algorithm.description: The HMAC Signature Algorithm used when signing an authorization request

request_signature_scope.description: Specifies whether to digitally sign an authorization request to the IdP

issuer_mode.description: Indicates whether Okta uses the original Okta org domain URL, or a custom domain URL

request_signature_algorithm.description: The XML digital Signature Algorithm used when signing an <AuthnRequest> message

request_signature_scope.description: Specifies whether to digitally sign <AuthnRequest> messages to the IdP

response_signature_algorithm.description: The minimum XML digital Signature Algorithm allowed when verifying a <SAMLResponse> message or <Assertion> element

response_signature_scope.description: Specifies whether to verify a <SAMLResponse> message or <Assertion> element XML digital signature

x5c.description: base64-encoded X.509 certificate chain with DER encoding

apple_kid.description: The Key ID that you obtained from Apple when you created the private key for the client

apple_private_key.description: The PKCS #8 encoded private key that you created for the client and downloaded from Apple

apple_team_id.description: The Team ID associated with your Apple developer account

issuer_mode.description: Indicates whether Okta uses the original Okta org domain URL, or a custom domain URL

associated_name.description: API name of the associated link.

associated_title.description: Display name of the associated link.

primary_name.description: API name of the primary link.

primary_title.description: Display name of the primary link.

associated_user_ids.description: Set of User IDs or login values of the users to be assigned the 'associated' relationship.

primary_name.description: Name of the 'primary' relationship being assigned.

primary_user_id.description: User ID to be assigned to 'primary' for the 'associated' user in the specified relationship.

asns.description: Format of each array value: a string representation of an ASN numeric value

dynamic_locations.description: Array of locations ISO-3166-1(2). Format code: countryCode OR countryCode-regionCode

dynamic_proxy_type.description: Type of proxy being controlled by this network zone

gateways.description: Array of values in CIDR/range form depending on the way it's been declared (i.e. CIDR will contain /suffix). Please check API docs for examples

name.description: Name of the Network Zone Resource

proxies.description: Array of values in CIDR/range form depending on the way it's been declared (i.e. CIDR will contain /suffix). Please check API docs for examples

status.description: Network Status - can either be ACTIVE or INACTIVE only

type.description: Type of the Network Zone - can either be IP or DYNAMIC only

billing_contact_user.description: User ID representing the billing contact

logo.description: Local path to logo of the org.

opt_out_communication_emails.description: Indicates whether the org's users receive Okta Communication emails

technical_contact_user.description: User ID representing the technical contact

extend_by.description: Number of days the support should be extended by

disk_encryption_type.description: List of disk encryption type, can be FULL, USER

jailbreak.description: The device jailbreak. Only for android and iOS platform

screenlock_type.description: List of screenlock type, can be BIOMETRIC or BIOMETRIC, PASSCODE

secure_hardware_present.description: Indicates if the device constains a secure hardware functionality

block.description: Manages device assurance on policy

tpsp_allow_screen_lock.description: Third party signal provider allow screen lock

tpsp_browser_version.description: Third party signal provider minimum browser version

tpsp_builtin_dns_client_enabled.description: Third party signal provider builtin dns client enabled

tpsp_chrome_remote_desktop_app_blocked.description: Third party signal provider chrome remote desktop app blocked

tpsp_device_enrollment_domain.description: Third party signal provider device enrollment domain

tpsp_disk_encrypted.description: Third party signal provider disk encrypted

groups_included.description: List of Group IDs to Include

is_oie.description: Is the policy using Okta Identity Engine (OIE) with authenticators instead of factors?

priority.description: Policy Priority, this attribute can be set to a valid priority. To avoid endless diff situation we error if an invalid priority is provided. API defaults it to the last (lowest) if not there.

is_oie.description: Is the policy using Okta Identity Engine (OIE) with authenticators instead of factors?

auth_provider.description: Authentication Provider: OKTA, ACTIVE_DIRECTORY or LDAP

call_recovery.description: Enable or disable voice call recovery: ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

email_recovery.description: Enable or disable email password recovery: ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

groups_included.description: List of Group IDs to Include

password_auto_unlock_minutes.description: Number of minutes before a locked account is unlocked: 0 = no limit.

password_dictionary_lookup.description: Check Passwords Against Common Password Dictionary.

password_exclude_first_name.description: User firstName attribute must be excluded from the password

password_exclude_last_name.description: User lastName attribute must be excluded from the password

password_exclude_username.description: If the user name must be excluded from the password.

password_expire_warn_days.description: Length in days a user will be warned before password expiry: 0 = no warning.

password_history_count.description: Number of distinct passwords that must be created before they can be reused: 0 = none.

password_lockout_notification_channels.description: Notification channels to use to notify a user when their account has been locked.

password_max_age_days.description: Length in days a password is valid before expiry: 0 = no limit.

password_max_lockout_attempts.description: Number of unsuccessful login attempts allowed before lockout: 0 = no limit.

password_min_age_minutes.description: Minimum time interval in minutes between password changes: 0 = no limit.

password_min_lowercase.description: If a password must contain at least one lower case letter: 0 = no, 1 = yes. Default = 1

password_min_number.description: If a password must contain at least one number: 0 = no, 1 = yes. Default = 1

password_min_symbol.description: If a password must contain at least one symbol (!@#$%^&*): 0 = no, 1 = yes. Default = 1

password_min_uppercase.description: If a password must contain at least one upper case letter: 0 = no, 1 = yes. Default = 1

password_show_lockout_failures.description: If a user should be informed when their account is locked.

priority.description: Policy Priority, this attribute can be set to a valid priority. To avoid endless diff situation we error if an invalid priority is provided. API defaults it to the last (lowest) if not there.

question_min_length.description: Min length of the password recovery question answer.

question_recovery.description: Enable or disable security question password recovery: ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

recovery_email_token.description: Lifetime in minutes of the recovery email token.

skip_unlock.description: When an Active Directory user is locked out of Okta, the Okta unlock operation should also attempt to unlock the user's Windows account.

sms_recovery.description: Enable or disable SMS password recovery: ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

email_recovery.description: Enable or disable email password recovery: ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

password_reset.description: Allow or deny a user to reset their password: ALLOW or DENY. Default = ALLOW

password_unlock.description: Allow or deny a user to unlock. Default = DENY

access.description: Allow or deny access based on the rule conditions: ALLOW or DENY

email_verification.description: Indicates whether email verification should occur before access is granted

inline_hook_id.description: ID of a Registration Inline Hook

progressive_profiling_action.description: Enabled or disabled progressive profiling action rule conditions: ENABLED or DISABLED

target_group_id.description: The ID of a Group that this User should be added to

ui_schema_id.description: Value created by the backend. If present all policy updates must include this attribute/value.

unknown_user_action.description: Which action should be taken if this User is new

label.description: A display-friendly label for this property

name.description: The name of a User Profile property

required.description: Indicates if this property is required for enrollment

access.description: Allow or deny access based on the rule conditions: ALLOW, DENY or CHALLENGE.

authtype.description: Authentication entrypoint: ANY, RADIUS or LDAP_INTERFACE

identity_provider.description: Apply rule based on the IdP used: ANY, OKTA or SPECIFIC_IDP.

identity_provider_ids.description: When identity_provider is SPECIFIC_IDP then this is the list of IdP IDs to apply the rule on

mfa_lifetime.description: Elapsed time before the next MFA challenge

mfa_prompt.description: Prompt for MFA based on the device used, a factor session lifetime, or every sign-on attempt: DEVICE, SESSION or ALWAYS

network_connection.description: Network selection mode: ANYWHERE, ZONE, ON_NETWORK, or OFF_NETWORK.

priority.description: Policy Rule Priority, this attribute can be set to a valid priority. To avoid endless diff situation we error if an invalid priority is provided. API defaults it to the last (lowest) if not there.

risc_level.description: Risc level: ANY, LOW, MEDIUM or HIGH

session_idle.description: Max minutes a session can be idle.

session_lifetime.description: Max minutes a session is active: Disable = 0.

session_persistent.description: Whether session cookies will last across browser sessions. Okta Administrators can never have persistent session cookies.

status.description: Policy Rule Status: ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

users_excluded.description: Set of User IDs to Exclude

groups_included.description: List of Group IDs to Include

priority.description: Policy Priority, this attribute can be set to a valid priority. To avoid endless diff situation we error if an invalid priority is provided. API defaults it to the last (lowest) if not there.

always_apply.description: Whether apply the changes to all users with this profile after updating or creating the these mappings.

delete_when_absent.description: When turned on this flag will trigger the provider to delete mapping properties that are not defined in config. By default, we do not delete missing properties.

source_id.description: The source id of the mapping to manage.

target_id.description: The target id of the mapping to manage.

communications_enabled.description: Enables rate limit warning, violation, notification emails and banners when this org meets rate limits.

login.description: Called when accessing the Okta hosted login page.

description.description: A description of the Resource Set

label.description: Unique name given to the Resource Set

resources.description: The endpoints that reference the resources to be included in the new Resource Set

block.description: Resource to manage administrative Role assignments for a User

report_suspicious_activity_enabled.description: Notifies end users about suspicious or unrecognized activity from their account

send_email_for_factor_enrollment_enabled.description: Notifies end users of any activity on their account related to MFA factor enrollment

send_email_for_factor_reset_enabled.description: Notifies end users that one or more factors have been reset for their account

send_email_for_new_device_enabled.description: Notifies end users about new sign-on activity

send_email_for_password_changed_enabled.description: Notifies end users that the password for their account has changed

end_user_dashboard_touch_point_variant.description: Variant for the Okta End-User Dashboard (`OKTA_DEFAULT`, `WHITE_LOGO_BACKGROUND`, `FULL_THEME`, `LOGO_ON_FULL_WHITE_BACKGROUND`)

links.description: Link relations for this object - JSON HAL - Discoverable resources related to the email template

sign_in_page_touch_point_variant.description: Variant for the Okta Sign-In Page (`OKTA_DEFAULT`, `BACKGROUND_SECONDARY_COLOR`, `BACKGROUND_IMAGE`)

theme_id.description: Theme ID - Note: Okta API for theme only reads and updates therefore the okta_theme resource needs to act as a quasi data source. Do this by setting theme_id.

action.description: Specifies how Okta responds to authentication requests from suspicious IPs

network_excludes.description: List of Network Zone IDs to exclude to be not logged or blocked by Okta ThreatInsight and proceed to Sign On rules evaluation

active.description: Whether the Trusted Origin is active or not - can only be issued post-creation

name.description: Unique name for this trusted origin

origin.description: Unique origin URL for this trusted origin

scopes.description: Scopes of the Trusted Origin - can either be CORS or REDIRECT only

custom_profile_attributes.description: JSON formatted custom attributes for a user. It must be JSON due to various types Okta allows.

custom_profile_attributes_to_ignore.description: List of custom_profile_attribute keys that should be excluded from being managed by Terraform.

display_name.description: User display name, suitable to show end users

expire_password_on_create.description: If set to `true`, the user will have to change the password at the next login. This property will be used when user is being created and works only when `password` field is set

old_password.description: Old User Password. Should be only set in case the password was not changed using the provider

password_inline_hook.description: When specified, the Password Inline Hook is triggered to handle verification of the end user's password the first time the user tries to sign in

raw_status.description: The raw status of the User in Okta - (status is mapped)

second_email.description: User secondary email address, used for account recovery

skip_roles.description: Do not populate user roles information (prevents additional API call)

status.description: The status of the User in Okta - remove to set user back to active/provisioned

algorithm.description: The algorithm used to generate the hash using the password

salt_order.description: Specifies whether salt was pre- or postfixed to the password before hashing

value.description: For SHA-512, SHA-256, SHA-1, MD5, This is the actual base64-encoded hash of the password (and salt, if used). This is the Base64 encoded value of the SHA-512/SHA-256/SHA-1/MD5 digest that was computed by either pre-fixing or post-fixing the salt to the password, depending on the saltOrder. If a salt was not used in the source system, then this should just be the the Base64 encoded value of the password's SHA-512/SHA-256/SHA-1/MD5 digest. For BCRYPT, This is the actual radix64-encoded hashed password.

work_factor.description: Governs the strength of the hash and the time required to compute it. Only required for BCRYPT algorithm

block.description: Specifies a hashed password to import into Okta.

disable_notifications.description: When this setting is enabled, the admins won't receive any of the default Okta administrator emails

pattern.description: The validation pattern to use for the subschema. Must be in form of '.+', or '[<pattern>]+' if present.'

permissions.description: SubSchema permissions: HIDE, READ_ONLY, or READ_WRITE.

type.description: Subschema type: string, boolean, number, integer, array, or object

groups.description: The list of Okta group IDs which the user should have membership managed for.

array_type.description: Subschema array type: string, number, integer, reference. Type field must be an array.

description.description: A human-readable description of the User type

display_name.description: The display name of the user type

id.description: Id of application to retrieve, conflicts with label and label_prefix.

label.description:
The label of the app to retrieve, conflicts with
				label_prefix and id. Label uses the ?q=<label> query parameter exposed by
				Okta's List Apps API. The API will search both name and label using that
				query. Therefore similarily named and labeled apps may be returned in the query
				and have the unitended result of associating the wrong app with this data
				source. See:
				https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/apps/#list-applications

label_prefix.description:
Label prefix of the app to retrieve, conflicts with label and id. This will tell the
				provider to do a starts with query as opposed to an equals query.

links.description: Discoverable resources related to the app

skip_groups.description: Ignore groups sync. This is a temporary solution until 'groups' field is supported in all the app-like resources

skip_users.description: Ignore users sync. This is a temporary solution until 'users' field is supported in all the app-like resources

groups.description: List of groups IDs assigned to the app

id.description: ID of the Okta App being queried for groups

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

The label of the app to retrieve, conflicts with
				label_prefix and id. Label uses the ?q=<label> query parameter exposed by
				Okta's List Apps API. The API will search both name and label using that
				query. Therefore similarily named and labeled apps may be returned in the query
				and have the unitended result of associating the wrong app with this data
				source. See:

Label prefix of the app to retrieve, conflicts with label and id. This will tell the

label.description:
The label of the app to retrieve, conflicts with label_prefix and id. Label 
				uses the ?q=<label> query parameter exposed by Okta's API. It should be noted that at this time 
				this searches both name and label. This is used to avoid paginating through all applications.

Label prefix of the app to retrieve, conflicts with label and id. This will tell the

include_users.description: Fetch group users, having default off cuts down on API calls.

block.description: Get the `Everyone` group from Okta.

delay_read_seconds.description: Force delay of the group read by N seconds. Useful when eventual consistency of group information needs to be allowed for; for instance, when group rules are known to have been applied.

include_users.description: Fetch group users, having default off cuts down on API calls.

type.description: Type of the group. When specified in the terraform resource, will act as a filter when searching for the group

users.description: Users associated with the group. This can also be done per user.

block.description: Get a group from Okta.

expression_type.description: The expression type to use to invoke the rule.

group_assignments.description: The list of group ids to assign the users to.

id.description: The ID of the Group Rule.

name.description: The name of the Group Rule.

users_excluded.description: The list of user IDs that would be excluded when rules are processed.

block.description: Get a group rule from Okta.

q.description: Searches the name property of groups for matching value

search.description: Searches for groups with a supported filtering expression for all attributes except for '_embedded', '_links', and 'objectClass'

type.description: Type of the group. When specified in the terraform resource, will act as a filter when searching for the groups

block.description: Get a list of groups from Okta.

idp_id.description: The id of the IdP to retrieve metadata for.

block.description: Get SAML IdP metadata from Okta.

authorization_binding.description: The method of making an authorization request.

authorization_url.description: IdP Authorization Server (AS) endpoint to request consent from the user and obtain an authorization code grant.

client_id.description: Unique identifier issued by AS for the Okta IdP instance.

client_secret.description: Client secret issued by AS for the Okta IdP instance.

issuer_mode.description: Indicates whether Okta uses the original Okta org domain URL, a custom domain URL, or dynamic.

jwks_binding.description: The method of making a request for the OIDC JWKS.

jwks_url.description: Endpoint where the keys signer publishes its keys in a JWK Set.

max_clock_skew.description: Maximum allowable clock-skew when processing messages from the IdP.

protocol_type.description: The type of protocol to use.

token_binding.description: The method of making a token request.

token_url.description: IdP Authorization Server (AS) endpoint to exchange the authorization code grant for an access token.

user_info_binding.description: The method of making a user info request.

user_info_url.description: Protected resource endpoint that returns claims about the authenticated user.

block.description: Get a OIDC IdP from Okta.

acs_type.description: Determines whether to publish an instance-specific (trust) or organization (shared) ACS endpoint in the SAML metadata.

audience.description: URI that identifies the target Okta IdP instance (SP)

issuer_mode.description: Indicates whether Okta uses the original Okta org domain URL, or a custom domain URL in the request to the IdP.

kid.description: Key ID reference to the IdP's X.509 signature certificate.

sso_destination.description: SSO request binding, HTTP-POST or HTTP-REDIRECT.

subject_filter.description: Regular expression pattern used to filter untrusted IdP usernames.

subject_format.description: Expression to generate or transform a unique username for the IdP user.

block.description: Get a SAML IdP from Okta.

account_link_action.description: Specifies the account linking action for an IdP user.

account_link_group_include.description: Group memberships to determine link candidates.

authorization_binding.description: The method of making an authorization request.

authorization_url.description: IdP Authorization Server (AS) endpoint to request consent from the user and obtain an authorization code grant.

client_id.description: Unique identifier issued by AS for the Okta IdP instance.

client_secret.description: Client secret issued by AS for the Okta IdP instance.

deprovisioned_action.description: Action for a previously deprovisioned IdP user during authentication.

groups_action.description: Provisioning action for IdP user's group memberships.

groups_attribute.description: IdP user profile attribute name for an array value that contains group memberships.

id.description: The id of the social idp to retrieve, conflicts with `name`.

issuer_mode.description: Indicates whether Okta uses the original Okta org domain URL, or a custom domain URL.

max_clock_skew.description: Maximum allowable clock-skew when processing messages from the IdP.

name.description: The name of the social idp to retrieve, conflicts with `id`.

profile_master.description: Determines if the IdP should act as a source of truth for user profile attributes.

protocol_type.description: The type of protocol to use.

provisioning_action.description: Provisioning action for an IdP user during authentication.

subject_match_attribute.description: Okta user profile attribute for matching transformed IdP username.

subject_match_type.description: Determines the Okta user profile attribute match conditions for account linking and authentication of the transformed IdP username.

suspended_action.description: Action for a previously suspended IdP user during authentication.

token_binding.description: The method of making a token request.

token_url.description: IdP Authorization Server (AS) endpoint to exchange the authorization code grant for an access token.

type.description: The type of Social IdP. See API docs [Identity Provider Type](https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/idps/#identity-provider-type)

username_template.description: Okta EL Expression to generate or transform a unique username for the IdP user.

block.description: Get a social IdP from Okta.

asns.description: Format of each array value: a string representation of an ASN numeric value

dynamic_locations.description: Array of locations ISO-3166-1(2). Format code: countryCode OR countryCode-regionCode

dynamic_proxy_type.description: Type of proxy being controlled by this network zone

gateways.description: Array of values in CIDR/range form depending on the way it's been declared (i.e. CIDR will contain /suffix). Please check API docs for examples

id.description: ID of the network zone to retrieve, conflicts with `name`.

name.description: Name of the network zone to retrieve, conflicts with `id`.

proxies.description: Array of values in CIDR/range form depending on the way it's been declared (i.e. CIDR will contain /suffix). Please check API docs for examples

status.description: Network Status - can either be ACTIVE or INACTIVE only

type.description: Type of the Network Zone - can either be IP or DYNAMIC only

block.description: Gets Okta Network Zone.

id.description: The unique identifier of the Org.

pipeline.description: The authentication pipeline of the org. idx means the org is using the Identity Engine, while v1 means the org is using the Classic authentication pipeline.

block.description: The URIs for the org's configured domains.

om_enabled.description: Whether the legacy Okta Mobile application is enabled for the org

block.description: The wellknown org settings (safe for public consumption).
Retrieves the well-known org metadata, which includes the id, configured custom domains, authentication pipeline, and various other org settings.
Get a policy from Okta.
Get subscriptions of a Role with a specific type

end_user_dashboard_touch_point_variant.description: Variant for the Okta End-User Dashboard (`OKTA_DEFAULT`, `WHITE_LOGO_BACKGROUND`, `FULL_THEME`, `LOGO_ON_FULL_WHITE_BACKGROUND`)

links.description: Link relations for this object - JSON HAL - Discoverable resources related to the email template

sign_in_page_touch_point_variant.description: Variant for the Okta Sign-In Page (`OKTA_DEFAULT`, `BACKGROUND_SECONDARY_COLOR`, `BACKGROUND_IMAGE`)

block.description: Get a single Theme of a Brand of an Okta Organization.

themes.description: List of `okta_them` belonging to the brand in the organization

block.description: Get Themes of a Brand of an Okta Organization.

filter.description: Filter criteria. Filter value will be URL-encoded by the provider

block.description: Get List of Trusted Origins using filters.

compound_search_operator.description: Search operator used when joining mulitple search clauses

delay_read_seconds.description: Force delay of the user read by N seconds. Useful when eventual consistency of user information needs to be allowed for.

skip_groups.description: Do not populate user groups information (prevents additional API call)

skip_roles.description: Do not populate user roles information (prevents additional API call)

user_id.description: Retrieve a single user based on their id

expression.description: A raw search expression string. This requires the search feature be on. Please see Okta documentation on their filter API for users. https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/resources/users#list-users-with-search

name.description: Property name to search for. This requires the search feature be on. Please see Okta documentation on their filter API for users. https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/resources/users#list-users-with-search

block.description: Filter to find user/users. Each filter will be concatenated with the compound search operator. Please be aware profile properties must match what is in Okta, which is likely camel case. Expression is a free form expression filter https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/core-okta-api/#filter . The set name/value/comparison properties will be ignored if expression is present

name.description: Name of user type to retrieve.

block.description: Get a user type from Okta.

compound_search_operator.description: Search operator used when joining mulitple search clauses

delay_read_seconds.description: Force delay of the users read by N seconds. Useful when eventual consistency of users information needs to be allowed for.

group_id.description: Find users based on group membership using the id of the group.

include_groups.description: Fetch group memberships for each user

include_roles.description: Fetch user roles for each user

users.description: collection of users retrieved from Okta.

expression.description: A raw search expression string. This requires the search feature be on. Please see Okta documentation on their filter API for users. https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/resources/users#list-users-with-search

name.description: Property name to search for. This requires the search feature be on. Please see Okta documentation on their filter API for users. https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/resources/users#list-users-with-search

block.description: Filter to find user/users. Each filter will be concatenated with the compound search operator. Please be aware profile properties must match what is in Okta, which is likely camel case. Expression is a free form expression filter https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/core-okta-api/#filter . The set name/value/comparison properties will be ignored if expression is present
